text: <@UANNN0Z7D> has joined the channel
Hi there. Giving DRP a test drive, so far I'm liking it. A couple of questions though...

First, the UI seems to flicker a _lot_. Every couple of seconds it grays out for a fraction of a second with a "waiting for endpoint" spinner. This makes it very hard to use. I'm guessing I'm holding it wrong somehow, any thoughts on what I might have done?
Chrome?
yes
Sadly... Restart your browser.  It seems to be an occasional issue with Chrome.
I see same issue on mine on Mac every few weeks.  Restart cleans it up.
yeah, was about to say: when you mentioned chrome, I saw I was running a version that's a couple months old. Updated, and it's all good now.
Xclnt.  I like easy fixes.  I won't lie about that...
the other one was that the debian-9 bootenv failed to install, it was failing to read from the DRP-provided mirror during the install process. Is that a KI?
I tried ubuntu 18.4 after that, and it installed fine, fwiw.
I'll take a look at it, but it won't be until tmw....
no worries, not urgent obviously :slightly_smiling_face:
Xclnt.  I like when it's not urgent... :upside_down_face:
prodding at it a bit more, :8091/debian-9/install/dists/ is entirely missing, so obviously the installer isn't happy. I'm assuming I've done something wrong, I'll keep digging.
Check the bootenv for errors.
Don't see any errors in the UI, or in dr-provision's logs.
well, good news is debian-8-install fails the same way. With that said, I believe I'm using DRP stable, lemme upgrade to latest and try my luck there.
Either way, seems very fixable, and I'll just test drive on ubuntu et al. in the meantime.
<@UANNN0Z7D> it's likely in the bootenv content not the drp service if other o/s are able to boot.   Debian is not as exercised as ubuntu or centos
Yup, my guess is the bootenv should be getting a bigger iso than the debian-mini edition. IIRC mini.iso has just enough in it to get online and grab everything else from remote repos
so, no local dist/ to serve.
The $faq has tips for setting internal mirrors but I don't know if it works for debian
FAQs are here > <http://provision.readthedocs.io/en/tip/doc/faq-troubleshooting.html>

I'm reasonably sure if I just upload the netinst iso instead of the mini iso that's listed in the bootenv, everything will work. I'll give that a shot once I'm done watching videos - trying to get straight how workflows, stages, tasks, profiles etc. all interact
